Vale la pena.

i love the portal franchise. i just enjoy it so much. over all, i just love thinking with portals. sometimes it totally bends my brain and makes me think in different ways. the physics in both games are so much fun to play with.
                                                                                                                       
the puzzles in the portal games get progressively more difficult and sometimes have multiple approaches. but the best part, to me at least, about the puzzles in these games is that there is no time limit, so the player can dink around with the environment for as long as they want before moving along.

finally, and what keeps me coming back to these games, is the humor. it is spot on and i laugh out loud every time i play.

Portal is a great puzzle game with a unique premise and some pretty challenging but enjoyable puzzles to solve.  Once you get the hang of it you can breeze through many of the levels fairly quickly, and the real challenge comes from the last few levels.  The second or third to last definitely had me sighing and scratching my head more than once.  But when you figure it out (don't use a guide guys, use your brain), it feels pretty darn good.
The only downside to this game is that it is short.  Really short.  I beat it in one sitting in about 3 hours.  When you start it tells you how many levels there are in total.  Without spoiling anything, the game continues beyond the final level.  I thought at that point maybe there was a huge chunk of the game still remaining, but in reality it doesn't continue much beyond that.
In summary, it's a great game, I got Portal 1 and 2 for a total of $3 on black Friday, so definitely worth it.
